repnme.cdata!:
Nicaragua - Agricultural and Industrial
            Rehabilitation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The agricultural component of the
            project would provide resources through participating
            institutions to reactivate production of crops and livestock
            and technical assistance to participating institutions.
            There would be three principal subcomponents: an
            agricultural rehabilitation credit line, an FED development
            credit line, and technical assistance. The industrial
            component would assist the government in its efforts to
            assist viable industrial enterprises to regain prewar levels
            of industrial output, exports, and employment. The FED would
            channel funds through participating intermediaries to
            industrial enterprises in order to finance the cost of goods
            and services for current production and for the repair or
            replacement of fixed installations.
